SEARCH
Package es.ulpgc.eii.spool.crawler.strategy

Interface PullCrawlerStrategy<T extends Event>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of Event produced by this strategy
All Superinterfaces:
CrawlerStrategy<T>
public interface PullCrawlerStrategy<T extends Event> extends CrawlerStrategy<T>
A CrawlerStrategy for on-demand, pull-based event ingestion.

PullCrawlerStrategy is the right choice when the framework needs to actively request data from a source on each cycle — for example, polling a REST API, querying a database, or reading a file. The source is only contacted when crawl() (or fetch()) is called.

Instances are built through the fluent factory API:


 PullCrawlerStrategy<ParkingEvent> strategy =
         PullCrawlerStrategy.from(apiSource)
                            .deserializeWith(raw -> JsonMapper.parse(raw, ParkingEvent.class));

 strategy.crawl().forEach(event -> process(event));
Since:
1.0.0

  • Method Details

    • fetch

      Stream<T> fetch()
      Fetches and deserializes all currently available events from the source.

      This is the core operation of the pull strategy. Each call triggers a fresh read from the underlying CrawlerSource, so the returned stream reflects the state of the source at the moment of the call.

      Returns:
      a non-null Stream of typed events; may be empty if the source has no new data available

    • crawl

      default Stream<T> crawl()
      Delegates to fetch(), fulfilling the CrawlerStrategy contract.

      Pull strategies do not maintain an internal buffer — every crawl() call results in a live read from the source.

      Specified by:
      crawl in interface CrawlerStrategy<T extends Event>
      Returns:
      the result of fetch()

    • from

      static <R> PullCrawlerStrategy.SourceStep<R> from(CrawlerSource<R> source)
      Entry point of the fluent builder for constructing a PullCrawlerStrategy.

      Usage:

      
 PullCrawlerStrategy<ParkingEvent> strategy =
         PullCrawlerStrategy.from(mySource)
                            .deserializeWith(myDeserializer);
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of raw payload provided by the source
      Parameters:
      source - the CrawlerSource to read raw payloads from; must not be null
      Returns:
      a PullCrawlerStrategy.SourceStep to continue the builder chain
